posts.content:
I am in need of a complete set of internal panels. Ideally I want rhd blue/grey panels for a small rear hatch - I have nothing right now so will be interested in anything on offer please - I would prefer good condition stuff but again recognise that beggars cannot be choosers. Just the vinyl will suit me as I am aware most vintage panels will need re-boarding. Anything out there?

Cheers,

Dave
Hup for the Bank Holiday

I am in need of a complete set of internal panels. Ideally I want rhd blue/grey panels for a small rear hatch - I have nothing right now so will be interested in anything on offer please - I would prefer good condition stuff but again recognise that beggars cannot be choosers. Just the vinyl will suit me as I am aware most vintage panels will need re-boarding. Anything out there?

Cheers,

Dave

Dave,

Have a look on Samba, a guy is the US is looking at doing accurate repro runs of these and caramel cards...not cheap thoand it may just be LHD, not sure....

The steel blue/grey cards are amongst the most rocking-horse s*** out there, never mind RHD ontop of that....

Hello again, I just thought that I'd let you know I am hoping to bring to market some repro commercial grey doorcards.
My van originally had these on but I have struggled to find ,I would say good, but just about any OG ones.
So a while back I set about making my own.
I've borrowed an OG door card as a colour template and I'm confident this next try will be the right one.

If the panels youre after has a similar /same texture as the commercial grey ones you might be in luck, of course I'd need a colour sample.

Let me know your thoughts.
Jason

falstaff wrote:Dave,

Have a look on Samba, a guy is the US is looking at doing accurate repro runs of these and caramel cards...not cheap thoand it may just be LHD, not sure....

The steel blue/grey cards are amongst the most rocking-horse s*** out there, never mind RHD ontop of that....


Thanks Falstaff - that must be EmpiGT - we have been in correspondence about this but he is not finished the r&D yet and as you say, small run production of such things is not cheap. I missed out on a whole set of interior panels earlier int he year - I hadn't appreciated how much I wanted them back then!! I know they are hard to find but someone must have some, even if it is just so I can get some colour matching done... I do like original panels if I can, even one panel at a time...

Cheers,

Dave

My van originally had these on but I have struggled to find ,I would say good, but just about any OG ones.
So a while back I set about making my own.

Thanks Jason,

that's great you'll be offering original commercial grey panels - I'm sure there will be lots of takers

I'm looking for the Blue Grey/ Dark Grey deluxe vinyl panels though.

Many thanks,

Dave

Mine are were Basalt grey amd silver beige from a microbus standard not a deluxe March 1962...will be getting round to selling some items when I have made a complete set.
I need to get on with restoring what I have and then making space..
LOL

Yes you do Graham!!!!!


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
You copied the headliner yet Dave?

Dave
What year what layout what seat colour style are you aiming at?
Is it a 61/62 Devon Caravette you have fitted?
I remember you were asking about fitting an hour glass cooker to a door mounted cupboard..
You have the two opening doors version rather than the one drop down version which sits under the flap..
I did read some of your resto thread ages ago but cannot remember what you wanted..
From thesamba.com VW interior pages what is the colourway?
G

I am taking my standard March 1962 microbus interior panels that were left, some I bought from etiennevert from a 1963 Devon Caravette and some I bought from DoubleD Deluxe Microbus and attempting to make a good set to suit a standard microbus layout.
I have panels with cut outs and impressions of the Devon Caravette layout cutlery tray..Sadly with a 6" X 9" speaker hole...
The silver beige material has a criss cross pattern layout which has worn/ faded away.
Some of the panels have a perfect level of pattern and some have very paint pattern..
I will be working on these over the winter...
Even experimenting with drawing pattern back on..
G

Graham, I am in the market for a set of 62 Caravette interior panels if you have some.
